title: Did Paul McCartney really love Linda the way it's been portrayed all these years? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think it’s easy for people to criticize Linda and talk about how she pushed her way into Paul’s bed and life but I don’t believe that. I think that Paul was obviously attracted physically to Linda and she was physically soothing to him after the break up of the Beaties but she was much more than that. I think Linda was a friend, a confidante, a sounding-board and a “shield from the world” to Paul McCartney for thirty years. She bore his children, she participated in his musical life, she listened to his hopes and dreams and made his life complete. I’m sure they argued like any couple would argue, but they lived a complex life for decades of touring incessantly and dealing with the media, which wasn’t her friend. How many times did they ask Linda if she broke up the Beatles? Linda also had to deal with women throwing themselves at her husband, the ”cute Beatle” while she lived out three pregnancies traversing the world with his band on a bus. He loved her! How can we ever question it? He probably didn’t realize how much he loved Linda until she was actually gone. Most relationships are like that…

I believe that he was ready for the family life when he met her. He knew that the bond he and John had shared over half of his life was fractured, he needed someone to be his world. He wanted children badly, he was a born daddy, she came with a ready made one. If he didn't deeply love her in the beginning I believe that he came to when she literally pulled him back from the void after the Beatles split. He and she had both been around the block. He the rock star who had sexed up hundreds of groupies and She the groupie who had sexed up more than her fair share of rock stars. Both of them were ready for something deeper. If it wasn't perfect well that's not our business. I never have heard even a hint that they weren't devoted to one another or that either of them ever cheated on the other. I also however think that he and Jane Asher never quite got over one another. I think if she had been willing to do the whole family thing it would have been her he married. But she and Paul had very different priorities in their lives. She's remained the class act by never doing a tell all, and it's easy money she's got plenty she could tell. Paul and Linda were a romance story, not Sleeping Beauty or Rapunzel perhaps but a romantic story. They spent thirty years together monogamously and she saved his life and career. She gave him back his confidence. What more can we ask for?

Oh My God. How can anyone answer that? Nobody can say about his feelings. We have no means to know. I am sure that lots of people will answer yes…But they just are unable to know. He used to say he loved her. So it must be true, why not? But honestly I don’t know and nobody knows except those close to them. Maybe one person will say he didn’t thanks to that tabloid article saying so. But that is not really for us to believe. I do hope he loved her. But I don’t think she was the only one. I do believe he also loved Jane Asher. And maybe Iris Caldwell. Or perhaps Virginia de Paula ( Oh, not this one. That is me! and he had never a chance to meet me to fall in love, what a shame!LOL) Only my feelings, of course. We have to remember Jane left him and he begged her to return. She didn’t. People tend to think he left her. It is our machist culture imagining only a man decides when to break up a romance. It is possible he loved Heather! Sure he regretted his decision to marry her, but maybe he felt or thought he was in love when he met her. I also think he loves or have similar good feelings for Nancy. He seems very happy by her side. And it is on her face she really loves him. She shines in all pictures. Seems to be a very nice woman.

Yes. There is no doubt in anyone’s mind how much Paul loved Linda. His songs are here for any skeptic to hear. One thing that bothers many people, including me, is how their relationship was – and still is – portrayed by the media. That “they never stayed away for more than 11 days” bullsh*t? I think that’s exactly what that is: bullsh*t Paul is on record many times saying that his relationship with his first wife was rather volatile, and not the perfection created by 90s media + McCartney fans. But he doesn’t go out of his way to clear that up, because why bother? It sure is good for his image to be seen as a fantastic husband and family man (I don’t doubt he is the latter, though), and That’s okay.

Paul adored Linda. They’ve been through so much together as any couple would and being in the spotlight 24/7, didn’t make it any easier. They supported each other, helped with charities for animals and vegetarians. I had the honor of seeing Paul in the late 80’s in Toronto, Linda singing backup. It was the most intense, amazing experience ever! It was heartbreaking for Paul when she passed away on April 17, 1998 of breast cancer at the young age of 56. She was considered his soulmate and I believe that.
